tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE InsuranceClaims (
 claim_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 policy_number VARCHAR(50),
 claim_date DATE,
 claim_amount DECIMAL(10, 2)
)

CREATE TABLE Claims (
    claim_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    company_id INT,
    policy_number VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    claim_amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    claim_status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    claim_date DATE NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (company_id) REFERENCES Insurance_Companies(company_id)
);

CREATE TABLE InsurancePolicy (
    policy_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_number VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    customer_id UUID NOT NULL,
    coverage_amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    effective_date DATE NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE Claim (
    claim_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_id UUID NOT NULL,
    claim_date DATE NOT NULL,
    claim_amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE CoverageVerification (
    verification_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_id UUID NOT NULL,
    verification_date DATE NOT NULL,
    verification_result VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE Payment (
    payment_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    claim_id UUID NOT NULL,
    payment_amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    payment_date DATE NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE Claims (
    claim_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    claim_date DATE NOT NULL,
    policy_number VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    company_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (company_id) REFERENCES Insurance_Companies(company_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Coverage (
    coverage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    coverage_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    deductable DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    company_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (company_id) REFERENCES Insurance_Companies(company_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Payments (
    payment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    payment_date DATE NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    claim_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (claim_id) REFERENCES Claims(claim_id)
);
